DataElement.preferredName: SF-36v2 Health Survey  Past 4 Weeks How Much Pain Has Interfered with Normal Work Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much in the past four weeks bodily pain has interfered with their normal work, including both work outside the home and housework, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Past 4 Weeks Quantity Pain Has Interfered with Normal Work Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about whether an individual has or had pain that interferes with their normal work._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire

Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses.

Concepts.longName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses.

Property.preferredName: Past 4 Weeks Quantity Pain Has Interfered with Normal Work Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A question about whether an individual has or had pain that interferes with their normal work.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.longName: Pain Has Interfered with Normal Work
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had pain that interferes with their normal work.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: SF-36v2:Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire, Sherbourne Cathy D; Ware John E., 1998
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 4/24/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A Likert scale that captures the score for how much interference exists from 1 (not at all) to 5 (extremely).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CCR study per request by D.Reeves. mc 7/26/13
